newsitem.title: MEXICO: GFInbur to start share exchange Oct 3.
newsitem.headline: GFInbur to start share exchange Oct 3.

text.p: Financial group Grupo Financiero Inbur will carry out a share exchange from Thursday with its insurance subsidiary Invercorporacion (Invecop) and with the firm Compsa, the group said on Wednesday.
The share exchange corresponds to the previously announced move for the companies to merge.

Invecop shareholders will have the right to receive 0.019197419 A series and 0.018444579 B series shares in GFInbur for each share they currently hold, the group said in a report to the Mexican Stock Exchange (BMV).
GFInbur will therefore issue 17,565,638 new A series and 16,876,790 B shares shares.
As foreign investors may not acquire A series shares in financial groups, they will be able to acquire 0.034890966 B series shares for each Invecop share they currently hold, the company said.
Invecop will thus no longer be listed on the BMV after Wednesday, GFInbur said.
Compsa shareholders, meanwhile, will have the right to acquire 0.38951064 A series and 0.037423565 B series shares for each share they currently hold.
After the merger, GFInbur will have 532,920,924 A series and 512,022,064 B series shares outstanding.
